meanings.definition: To lift or pull abruptly or forcefully.
meanings.sent1: She hoiks the heavy bag onto her shoulder.
meanings.sent2: He hoiks the rope to raise the flag.
meanings.sent3: With a hoiks, she managed to get the stubborn drawer open.
meanings.sent4: The crane hoiks the container effortlessly into the air.
meanings.sent5: The magician hoiks the rabbit out of the hat with a flourish.

meanings.sent1: The sudden hoiks on the fishing line indicated a big catch.
meanings.sent2: He felt a hoiks on his sleeve as his friend pulled him back.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected hoiks on the leash made the dog jump.
meanings.sent4: The hoiks on the fabric revealed a hidden compartment.
meanings.sent5: The hoiks on the rollercoaster made everyone scream with excitement.

meanings.definition: An exclamation of surprise or effort.
meanings.sent1: Hoiks! I didn't expect to see you here.
meanings.sent2: Hoiks! That was a close call.
meanings.sent3: Hoiks! I almost dropped the cake.
meanings.sent4: Hoiks! The cat just jumped out of nowhere.
meanings.sent5: Hoiks! Look at the size of that spider!
